issue.title: Port CLI to click
issue.body:
- [x] Color codes need to be ported, should retain compatibility with config values
- [x] https://github.com/mitsuhiko/click/issues/200 -- fixed in version 3.1
- [x] https://github.com/mitsuhiko/click/issues/201  -- fixed in 3.2
- [x] https://github.com/mitsuhiko/click/issues/205  -- fixed in 3.2
- [x] Write tests

Notes:
- Color codes are largely compatible, but they have different escape sequences.
- We depend on click 3.2

body: Workaround: For some cases, checking for the truthness of `ctx.args` is good enough.

issue.title: Use different method for propagating ctx.obj

repository.name: click

issue.title: Use different method for propagating ctx.obj

repository.name: click
repository.description: Python composable command line interface toolkit

body: This is a stupid situation I brought this into.  As far as I can see there is no real way to fix this.  I need to think about what I actually want this to do now.
Comments on the PR? I actually tried splitting the operations of handle_subcommand up, but that didn't work well with chained commands.

While the solution is neat, it causes artifacts because callbacks for instance cannot accept the object yet which causes issues.  I much rather remove the `invoked_subcommands` property again and just provide a "*" for multi invokes.
Just supporting a single `invoked_subcommand` is possible because it requires a single lookahead which is okay.
